clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Heart Rate Variability Biofeedback Training on Health of Intrapartum Women
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Heart Rate Variability Biofeedback Training on the Physical and Mental Health of Intrapartum Women

lead_sponsor.agency: National Taipei University of Nursing and Health Sciences

clinical_study.source: National Taipei University of Nursing and Health Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, the investigators examined the efficacy of heart rate variability biofeedback on physical and mental health problems in childbirth women.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, the investigators examined the efficacy of heart rate variability biofeedback on physical and mental health problems in childbirth women. The following validated self-report measures were administered before and at five days after the intervention, Perceived stress scale-10, Beck Anxiety Inventory, and Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale.

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline on childbirth first day (before the intervention) .
primary_outcome.description: The Perceived Stress Scale using 10 items to determine the self-perceived levels of unpredictability, lack of control, and burden during the last month of pregnancy. Responses are rated from 0 (never) to 4 (very often), with higher scores corresponding to higher perceived stress.

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline on childbirth first day (before the intervention).
primary_outcome.description: The Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale was using 10 items to provide a valuable and efficient way to identify patients at risk of perinatal depression. primary_outcome.description: The Beck Anxiety Inventory using 21 items on the scale describes a symptom of anxiety. Responses are rated from 0 (never) to 3 (very often), with higher scores corresponding to higher perceived anxiety.

arm_group.arm_group_label: heart rate variability biofeedback training group
arm_group.description: The goal of heart rate variability biofeedback is to increase heart rate variability through paced breathing exercises, which have shown to be effective in reducing stress and anxiety in general adult populations.
In this condition, all of this group take care by hospital routine and the questionnaires were completed over a period with similar intervals.

intervention.intervention_name: heart rate variability biofeedback Application (Eureka iDestressor)
intervention.description: heart rate variability biofeedback protocol duration time is 10 min twice/day for 5days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- woman
- aged 20 years or more
- able to understand and write Chinese
- singleton birth
- having a full-term and healthy newborn
Exclusion Criteria:
- suicidal ideations
- psychosis
- medical or obstetric complications
